intro: Secamone laevis, commonly known as the smooth secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
